oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Virgil Metcalf to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Metcalf, Co. A, 47th Engineer Battn., consistently corresponds with his mother while in service. He lets her know that all are okay and that he is contemplating making his home in America before many months. Metcalf was from McMinn County, Tennessee. His unit becomes 47th Regt. Transportation Corps. They left France in June 1919 and returned to Camp Dix, NJ.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
